LinkIdTextCardinalityTypeFlagsDescription & Constraints
EmCare.B10-14.Symptoms.2m.pQuestionnairehttps://fhir.dk.swisstph-mis.ch/matchbox/fhir/Questionnaire/emcare.b10-14.symptoms.2m.p#0.1.0
Danger Signsnull0..1booleanExpressions:
  • Initial Value: danger signs
EmCare.B12S1.DE01null0..1booleanExpressions:
  • Initial Value: emcare.b12s1.de01
AgeInMonthsAge0..1integerExpressions:
  • Initial Value: ageinmonths
EmCare.B10S1.DE05Cough1..1boolean
EmCare.B10S1.DE06Cough for how long?0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
Expressions:
  • Enable When: %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B10S1.DE05').answer.first().value = true
EmCare.B10S1.DE01Difficulty Breathing1..1boolean
EmCare.B10S1.DE01-helpDifficult breathing is any unusual pattern of breathing. Caregivers describe this<br /> in different ways. They may say that their child’s breathing is “fast” or “noisy” or “interrupted.” If a mother answers no, look to see if you think the child has cough or difficult breathing.0..1display
EmCare.B10S1.DE02Difficulty breathing for how long?0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
Expressions:
  • Enable When: %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B10S1.DE01').answer.first().value = true
EmCare.B11S1.DE01Diarrhoea1..1boolean
EmCare.B11S1.DE01-helpDiarrhoea occurs when stools contain more water than normal, and are loose or watery. Diarrhoea is defined as three or more loose or watery stools in a 24-hour period.0..1display
EmCare.B11S1.DE02Diarrhoea for how long?0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
Expressions:
  • Enable When: %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B11S1.DE01').answer.first().value= true
EmCare.B11S1.DE05Blood in the stool in this Illness0..1booleanExpressions:
  • Enable When: %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B11S1.DE01').answer.first().value= true
EmCare.B11S1.DE05-helpAsk the mother if she has seen blood in the stools at any time during this episode of diarrhoea. Dysentery is diarrhoea with blood in the stool, with or without mucus. The most common cause of dysentery is Shigella bacteria. Dysentery will require specific treatments.0..1display
EmCare.B12S1.DE02Fever Reported1..1boolean
EmCare.B12S1.DE02-helpAsk the caregiver: “Does the child have fever?” The child has a history of fever if the child has had any fever with this illness0..1display
EmCare.B12S1.DE03-lFever for how long?0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
Expressions:
  • Enable When: %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B.G.DE06').answer.first().value= true and %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B12S1.DE02').answer.first().value=true
EmCare.B12S1.DE03Fever for how long?0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
Expressions:
  • Calculated Value: iif(%resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B.G.DE06').answer.first().value= true and %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B12S1.DE02').answer.first().value=false,'EmCare.B12S1.DE04',%resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B12S1.DE03-l').answer.first().value)
EmCare.B.G.DE06Fever0..1booleanExpressions:
  • Calculated Value: %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B12S1.DE01').answer.first().value = true or %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B12S1.DE02').answer.first().value = true
EmCare.B12S1.DE06Has Fever been present every day since the Fever started?0..1booleanExpressions:
  • Enable When: %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B12S1.DE03-l').answer.first().value.code = 'EmCare.B12S1.DE05' and %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B.G.DE06').answer.first().value = true
EmCare.B13S1.DE01Ear problem1..1boolean
EmCare.B13S1.DE02Ear pain1..1booleanExpressions:
  • Enable When: %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B13S1.DE01').answer.first().value = true
EmCare.B13S1.DE02-helpIf the carIf the caregiver is not sure that the child has ear pain, ask if the child has been irritable and rubbing his ear. egiver is not sure that the child has ear pain, ask if the child has been irritable and rubbing his ear.0..1display
EmCare.B13S1.DE03Ear discharge0..1booleanExpressions:
  • Enable When: %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B13S1.DE01').answer.first().value = true
EmCare.B13S1.DE04Ear discharge for how long?0..1choiceOptions: 2 options
Expressions:
  • Enable When: %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B13S1.DE03').answer.first().value = true
EmCare.B14S1.DE03Eye Problem1..1boolean
EmCare.B14S1.DE01Skin Problem1..1booleanExpressions:
  • Enable When: %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='Danger Signs').answer.first().empty() or %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='Danger Signs').answer.first().value = false
EmCare.B14S1.DE02Itchy Skin1..1booleanExpressions:
  • Enable When: %resource.repeat(item).where(linkId='EmCare.B14S1.DE01').answer.first().value = true
timestampnull0..1dateTimeExpressions:
  • Calculated Value: now()

item.text:
Difficult breathing is any unusual pattern of breathing. Caregivers describe this
in different ways. They may say that their child’s breathing is “fast” or “noisy” or “interrupted.” If a mother answers no, look to see if you think the child has cough or difficult breathing.
Diarrhoea occurs when stools contain more water than normal, and are loose or watery.  Diarrhoea is defined as three or more loose or watery stools in a 24-hour period.
Blood in the stool in this Illness

Ask the mother if she has seen blood in the stools at any time during this episode of diarrhoea. Dysentery is diarrhoea with blood in the stool, with or without mucus. The most common cause of dysentery is Shigella bacteria. Dysentery will require specific treatments.
Ask the caregiver: “Does the child have fever?” The child has a history of fever if the child has had any fever with this illness
Has Fever been present every day since the Fever started?

If the carIf the caregiver is not sure that the child has ear pain, ask if the child has been irritable and rubbing his ear. egiver is not sure that the child has ear pain, ask if the child has been irritable and rubbing his ear.
